definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
sound producing object (soundboard, vibrating string, membrane etc)

sentences.english: Women do phonological processing with both their right and left inferior frontal gyri .
sentences.chinese: 女人是利用她們左右眉骨後的側腦回發音的。

sentences.english: Specifically, the clarity and projection of the altissimo range.
sentences.chinese: 具體地說，可以影響高音區發音的清晰度和穿透力嗎？

sentences.english: She said she had some difficulty with pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 她說她在發音方面有困難。

sentences.english: Many tapes don't have standard pronounciation.
sentences.chinese: 很多錄音帶上的發音不標準。

sentences.english: What do you think I should do to improve my English pronounciation?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得我應該怎麼做才能提高我的英語發音？

sentences.english: Imitative words are words that sound like the thing or action they stand for.
sentences.chinese: 擬聲詞是發音像它們所代表的意思的詞。

sentences.english: Other languages have different pronunciations of the name of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 其他語言中對於“耶穌”這個名字發音不同。

sentences.english: Mispronunciation of this word is comparatively rare.
sentences.chinese: 把此字發音讀錯的人較少。

sentences.english: A baby cries and gurgles but does not use articulate speech .
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒僅啼哭和咯咯作聲，卻無法清晰的發音。

sentences.english: School teachers probably cringe at this kind of pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 學校的老師們對這樣的發音恐怕是不敢恭維。

sentences.english: The tongue is one of the vocal organs.

sentences.chinese: 我們更驚歎她那動人的發音。

sentences.english: If you are attending school, you must go through the different stages of learning pronunciation, grammar and reading.
sentences.chinese: 假如你是上學的，你必經過發音，文法，閱讀等程序。

sentences.english: So names that are difficult to pronounce seem to have negative connotations?
sentences.chinese: 由上所述，發音難唸的名字難道就有不祥的涵義嗎？

definition: Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character

Chinese language (Mandarin), emphasizing its national nature/Chinese as a primary or secondary school subject/Chinese in the context of the Nationalist Government/Guoyu, book of historical narrative c. 10th-5th century BC
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
